reviews.review_msg: Avoid this class if you can - the professor relies heavily on the textbook and quizzes/exams don't align well. However, unstuckstudy ai and other study tools like ChatGPT helped me stay on top of the heavy workload. Overall, a tough course but manageable with the right resources.

Be prepared for a textbook-heavy class with minimal lecture content. The exams and assignments focus heavily on the textbook, so staying on top of the readings is crucial. Expect a challenging course with frequent quizzes and exams.
Avoid his class for psyc 100 because I felt that he did not really teach the material in lectures and just wanted us to memorize the textbook for exams.

very textbook heavy and he doesn't teach and the assignments are based all on the textbook. quizzes and exams are based on the textbook but worded very confusing and answers are very similar in wording.
Weekly quizzes and biweekly exams and writing assignments are terrible. Dude does q and a on emails instead of teaching. Your time will revolve around this class if you want to get a good grade.
So much reading, and he barely teaches. The quizzes dont prepare you for the exams. The chapters are long and boring. Tough course in my opinion.

bro this class is making me re think being a psychology major. Great start from psyc100 failing almost everything because he doesnt teach! maybe with a lot of self teaching you can get a good mark but not doable when you have other classes too. Not worth it if you dont like reading or memorizing the whole the whole damn textbook bruh

This guy does not teach, going to lectures is a waste of time and all the work is textbook based. Quizzes every week, exams and timed in-class writing assignments biweekly. Literally cannot catch a break. He gets upset when you don't show up to lectures but he doesn't do anything anyways lol. Don't take this class with him hehe.

Took this class via remote learning and it was average. Stopped attending live lectures as they really did not help at all for quizzes or exams. READ THE TEXTBOOK!!!!! All quizzes are 100% based off textbook material so read the chapter and do the mind tap and you will be fine. 2 assignments were relatively easy and plenty of time to complete.

I have heard this man talk 4 times max. All I did was study the textbook and I finished with an A in the course. Quizzes and exams were fair with various types of questions. Assignment was straight forward. Love that he drops the lowest exam and quiz marks. Memorization and applying concepts is crucial to succeed in this course!!
I literally taught myself this class. Read the textbook and take notes to pass the exams lol. Never showed up to lecture and got same mark as friend who showed up. At least there's no final.

no point to go to class he just reads from the slides which is literally the textbook. only reason I went was for the bonus questions. super hard to get good grades on written part of exam with the average being 9/20. mc was hard too. no point to study you'll probably get the same mark if u guess.

This professor give so much work and has exams almost every other week. His assignments are basically term papers. He does give enough information in lectures but asks so much specific question in tests. the lectures are basically none existent because its of no use.
There is no point in showing up to lectures, you basically have to teach yourself this class.
not a good choice for 100 lvl class

Lectures are very boring and you do not need to attend class to pass. Focus mostly on the textbook because his lecture quiz and term exam questions are from there. His lecture slides are totally useless. He definetly expects way too much for a first year course. Content was not too hard to grasp, and is an easy A class.
multiple choice questions are ridicious, all the answers are all possible/there is no exact one answer BEWARE

Never take his class. Does not prepare you for any tests. Goes on random tangents every class that have nothing to do with the chapter and are usually about himself. His slides consists of 1 word points that aren't explained on why they're important. Expects students to do tests that are 70% lecture based even though his lectures are about himself.

Dr. Day is my favourite prof at SFU so far. He's super friendly and always makes his classes fun (which is actually pretty useful for remembering the lecture content later). All you need to do to ace this course is read the textbook chapters and do the LaunchPad quizzes. Grading is super clear and generous (he drops your worst exam AND quiz).

For an intro psych course with pretty general material, Russell did a good job of making lectures fun to attend. However, they do feel pretty pointless and he has a tendency to go on tangents that don't show up on tests. But the class had 4 midterms and no final so that was a good thing!

If you're the type of student that never wants to attend class but still needs the motivation to study then this class is perfect. Only attended classes with quizzes or exams which motivated me to study even though I went once every week or two. Iclicker quizzes are easy marks while the exams are trickier because of the written sections.

Day's lectures were long and painful. However, it is possible to get a good mark by reading the textbook. Very stressful course in that there was a test every 5 classes.  You don't need to attend lecture, just look at his slides online and then find the details in the textbook.
No Comments
